[–]Goldeneye45 59 points 11 hours ago*
This is also compounded by the fact that Hiro, literally right before the apple scene, figures out that licking her blood was the key to being compatible with Zero Two. Therefore, when he didn't lick Ichigo's wound and instead bandages it, that was a straight up REJECTION of the idea that he would like to pilot with Ichigo, or anyone that isn't Zero Two. But the symbolism doesn't stop there, even though Ichigo confesses to him in the final scene and says "I love you" all he can think of is Zero Two and looks up as her plane flies by overhead. Hiro not responding to Ichigo is not just for suspense for the next episode, but by looking at the plane it is also a "look at what you did" moment to Ichigo. Hiro realizes that Ichigo betrayed him and, in a way, caused Zero Two to freak out. Can't wait for next episode.
